title: 'Man on Wire' Philippe Petit still risks it all at 73
summary: Almost 50 years after his famed tight-rope walk between the Twin Towers in New York, Philippe Petit still has his head in the clouds. Clad in an orange shirt and red suspenders, the 73-year-old French native peers across the vast lobby of a Washington museum, the site of his next exploit. Reaching into his pocket, he pulls out a short red string. "Sometimes I stop and say, 'It would be nice to put a wire there,'" he told AFP, showing how he holds it out at arm's length to get a sense of the set up. Even at his age, Petit still plans to make the walk without a safety net or harness.

title: Putin to rain fire on Ukraine? Kyiv gets first batches of West's Leopard and Challenger tanks
summary: The West's much-talked-about tank challenge for Russia has reached Ukraine. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz confirmed that Berlin has delivered the first batch of 'deadly' Leopard 2 main battle tanks to Ukraine. The consignment from Germany contains 18 modern Leopard 2A6 tanks, along with two armoured recovery vehicles, ammunition, and spare parts. However, the tank challenge for Russian President Vladimir Putin does not end there. The British Challenger 2 tanks have also reached Ukraine, said the Ukrainian Defence Minister. Spain has also said its first batch of six Leopard 2A4S would be sent by the end of this week. The influx of western tanks is set to amp up the intensity of the war in Ukraine. Moscow has taken a pledge to 'burn the West's tanks on the battlefield. Watch this report for more.

summary: The 16th edition of the IPL will kick off with a clash between two captains who are also great friends off the field. As is tradition, the defending champions will start the season and match 1 of IPL 2023 will see the reigning champions Gujarat Titans take on 4 time champions the Chennai Super Kings in Ahmedabad.

title: Several Sabarimala pilgrims injured as bus falls in pit in Kerala
summary: Several Sabarimala pilgrims were injured after the bus they were travelling fell into a deep pit at Ilavunkal in Kerala's Pathanamthitta district on Tuesday.

title: EPFO fixes 8.15% interest rate on employees' provident fund for 2022-23
summary: The retirement fund body EPFO-Employees' Provident Fund Organization-has fixed 8.15% interest rate on employees' provident fund for 2022-23, PTI reported quoting sources on Tuesday.

title: Show us proof that he is in illegal custody: HC to Amritpal's lawyer
summary: The Punjab and Haryana high court on Tuesday asked the petitioner — who has alleged illegal detention of radical Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh — to show some evidence proving that he is in illegal custody of the state police.

title: Liquor seized from coffin in Gaya mortuary van
summary: A team of excise department officials found only spirit and no body inside a coffin that they intercepted on a tip-off in the dry state of Bihar on Monday. It is no spooky story but one of innovative smuggling methods. In a bid to dodge the authorities, liquor smugglers concealed 212 bottles (around 159 litres) of India-made foreign liquor (IMFL) in a coffin and ferried it in a mortuary van.

title: Citroen's new Creta, Grand Vitara rival global unveil on April 27
summary: What could possibly be known as the 'C3 Aircross', the upcoming mid-size SUV is all set to make its global debut on April 27, and will rival the likes of Hyundai Creta, Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara, Skoda Kushaq.

title: IPL 2023 Opening Ceremony: When and where to watch
summary: The 16th edition of the Indian Premier League is now around the corner. IPL 2023 kicks off on March 31. As is the tradition, the defending champions play the first match and this time we will see the Gujarat Titans, led by Hardik Pandya, go up against 4 time champions the Chennai Super Kings, captained by MS Dhoni.

title: Nadiad teacher held for threatening post against PM Modi
summary: Cybercrime police on Monday arrested a teacher from Nadiad for allegedly issuing a threat to Prime Minister Narendra Modi through a Facebook post on Saturday.

title: EPS becomes AIADMK general secretary
summary: The announcement was made by AIADMK election officials Pollachi V Jayaraman and former minister Natham R Viswanathan at the party headquarters in Royapettah, minutes after the Madras high court dismissed the petitions challenging the resolutions passed at the general council on July 11.

title: Watch: MS Dhoni enjoys spray painting, shows his love for Chepauk
summary: Chennai Super King skipper MS Dhoni took his time off the practice to try his hands at spray painting and he seemed to have enjoyed every bit of it while colouring chairs at Chepauk stands in Chennai.

title: Greener pastures: Japan now the land of rising sons of India
Territorial UP tigers ‘refuse entry’ to 6 leopards at reserve
summary: Foresters at the Amangarh Tiger Reserve (ATR) are scratching their heads over a peculiar problem. In the last two months, they have trapped and rescued six leopards from human habitats that have seen an increasing number of man-animal conflicts. But the felines that were then released into ATR were "refused entry" into the jungle by tigers and pushed right back to the forest's fringes close to villages and farm fields. Now it's back to square one.

title: Odia actress Ruchismita Guru found dead at uncle’s house
summary: Aspiring Odia actress Ruchismita Guru who has mostly featured in music albums was found dead at her uncle’s house under mysterious circumstances. Investigation is underway as police suspect she died by suicide.

title: Actor Vikraman Nair passes away
summary: Popular theatre actor breathes his last on Monday night.

title: Watch: Dehradun daredevil caught by cops after posting stunt video
summary: Dehradun Police took to Twitter to announce that they have seized the vlogger's Kawasaki Ninja ZX-10R motorcycle and registered a case under relevant sections.

title: Kerala: Revenue from liquor set to hit all-time high
summary: In a relief to the ailing revenue collection of the state, the excise department is set to meet its revised revenue collection target set for the financial year 2022-23, which would come to a close in two more days.

title: Free all Amritpal aides in 24 hours: Akal Takht jathedar to Punjab govt
summary: The Akal Takht jathedar on Monday presided over a meeting of Sikh organisations that decided on taking out a 'Khalsa Vahir' or religious march across Punjab to expose what they called the government's machinations if the arrested Amritpal sides weren't freed within 24 hours.

title: Innocent laid to rest with full state honours
summary: The veteran actor passed away on Sunday (March 26) night.

title: E-shoppers from tier-2 cities bigger spenders than tier-1: IIM-Ahmedabad survey
summary: A survey carried out by IIM Ahmedabad (IIM-A) indicated that tier-2 cities including Ahmedabad are now bigger spenders per purchase online than metros such as Mumbai, Delhi, etc. E-shoppers from such cities spent about 60% more than their metro counterparts or tier-1 cities.

title: When Section 144 helps regulate syrup sales, kite flying!
summary: An emergency provision that police historically used for maintaining law and order was used to regulate the sale of cough syrups, the flying of kites and stopping the sale of namkeen near liquor vends, a study has found.

title: Bhojpuri actress death: Mother demands CBI inquiry
summary: Dubey's family has now demanded a CBI inquiry into her death. Her mother, Madhu Dubey has filed a complaint against Bhojpuri singer Samar Singh and his brother Sanjay Singh at the Sarnath police station.

title: Researchers unearth 2,000 ram heads in Egypt temple
summary: Archaeologists in Egypt have discovered more than 2,000 ancient mummified sheep heads left as offerings in a temple to the pharaoh Ramses II, the tourism and antiquities ministry said Sunday. Mummies of dogs, goats, cows, gazelles and mongooses were also exhumed by a team of US archaeologists from New York University at Abydos, a site in southern Egypt famous for its temples and tombs.

title: Humza Yousaf to be 1st person of colour to lead Scotland
summary: Pakistani-origin Humza Yousaf is the new leader of the Scottish National Party and will be the first Muslim to lead a country in Western Europe when he becomes Scotland’s first ethnic minority and first Muslim first minister on Tuesday at a time when the UK has its first Hindu, Indian-origin prime minister.

title: US-born Mongolian boy named 3rd highest spiritual leader
Prices of essential drugs set to increase from April
summary: The government is all set to allow drug companies an increase in line with the change in the annual Wholesale Price Index (WPI). The annual change in WPI, as notified by the government, works out to 12.12% during 2022, the drug prices regulator National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) said on Monday.

title: IT hiring to slow further as global banks turn cautious
summary: The crisis engulfing global banks in the US and Europe is likely to create additional stress on Indian IT industry that is already staring at macroeconomic pressures. It is set to almost halve net headcount growth of the sector in the coming fiscal and bring in other structural changes to HR strategies.

title: Fast-­track courts clogged too, pendency up 40% in last 3yrs
summary: Fast-track courts, set up for the purpose of expediting disposal of long-pending cases and those against women, children, elderly and the disabled, have been clogged like normal courts, with pendency increasing by 40% in the last three years - from 10.7 lakh, pending cases have gone up to over 15 lakh in these FTCs since 2020.

title: IPL 2023 schedule: All matches time table, venues and groups
summary: Defending champions Gujarat Titans will take on four-time champions Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2023 opener in Ahmedabad, the BCCI announced on Friday as it unveiled the schedule for the upcoming season. The tournament starts from March 31 and the last league match will be played on May 21, the IPL announced.

title: 3.5x rise in high-Covid districts in two weeks
summary: Pointing to a steady spread of Covid-19 infections in the country, the latest government data shows that the number of districts with a weekly test positivity rate (TPR) of 10% or more has increased to 32 across 14 states and UTs, a 3.5-fold rise in two weeks. TPR is the percentage of total samples testing positive for Covid.

title: Amid Savarkar row, Uddhav snubs Cong, to skip key meet
summary: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena said on Monday it will skip a meeting of opposition parties called by Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge at his Delhi residence over Rahul Gandhi's comments against Vinayak 'Veer' Savarkar.
